document_metadata.name: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: The tau-protein is a natively soluble protein that plays a key role in the dynamics of microtubules

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: The overexpression of full-length tau in Chinese hamster ovary (CHO) cells [3], N2A cells [4], cultured retinal ganglion cells [4], NB2a/d1 cells [5] H4-cells [6], and primary cortical neuron cultures [6] led to an impairment of anterograde transport of a variety of kinesin cargos, including mitochondria

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In the pathological case of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) tau becomes hyperphosphorylated, detaches from the microtubules, misfolds, and mislocalizes to the somatodendritic compartment where it aggregates into neurofibrillary tangles.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In the pathological case of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) tau becomes hyperphosphorylated, detaches from the microtubules, misfolds, and mislocalizes to the somatodendritic compartment where it aggregates into neurofibrillary tangles.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In the pathological case of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) tau becomes hyperphosphorylated, detaches from the microtubules, misfolds, and mislocalizes to the somatodendritic compartment where it aggregates into neurofibrillary tangles.

citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In the pathological case of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) tau becomes hyperphosphorylated, detaches from the microtubules, misfolds, and mislocalizes to the somatodendritic compartment where it aggregates into neurofibrillary tangles.

citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In the pathological case of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) tau becomes hyperphosphorylated, detaches from the microtubules, misfolds, and mislocalizes to the somatodendritic compartment where it aggregates into neurofibrillary tangles.

citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In the pathological case of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) tau becomes hyperphosphorylated, detaches from the microtubules, misfolds, and mislocalizes to the somatodendritic compartment where it aggregates into neurofibrillary tangles.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In the pathological case of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) tau becomes hyperphosphorylated, detaches from the microtubules, misfolds, and mislocalizes to the somatodendritic compartment where it aggregates into neurofibrillary tangles.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: The overexpression of full-length tau in Chinese hamster ovary (CHO) cells [3], N2A cells [4], cultured retinal ganglion cells [4], NB2a/d1 cells [5] H4-cells [6], and primary cortical neuron cultures [6] led to an impairment of anterograde transport of a variety of kinesin cargos, including mitochondria

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: This leads to accumulation of mitochondria in the cell body where they cluster near the microtubule center [6].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Thies and Mandelkow [7] have shown previously that the co-expression of microtubule-associated protein/microtubule affinityregulating kinase 2 (MARK2) with tau can rescue these effects caused by tau overexpression in vitro.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Thies and Mandelkow [7] have shown previously that the co-expression of microtubule-associated protein/microtubule affinityregulating kinase 2 (MARK2) with tau can rescue these effects caused by tau overexpression in vitro.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: The two major pathways for protein degradation in cells are through the ubiquitin-proteasome system and the autophagy-lysosome system [10, 11], both of which have been implicated in tau degradation in AD [12].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: The two major pathways for protein degradation in cells are through the ubiquitin-proteasome system and the autophagy-lysosome system [10, 11], both of which have been implicated in tau degradation in AD [12].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Misfolded tau proteins, like other natively unfolded molecules, can be detected and cleared by chaperone assisted mechanisms [13].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Recent data suggest that a critical mediator of refolding or clearance of hyperphosphorylated tau is via the HSP70/HSP90 heat shock pathways in which a specific E3 ubiquitin ligase, CHIP (carboxy terminus Hsp70 interacting protein), can recognize and target for degradation abnormal but not normal tau molecules [14–16].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Several publications suggest that molecular chaperones, e.g., heat shock protein 70 and 90 (Hsp70, Hsp90) play a fundamental role in the clearance of misfolded proteins including tau [12].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Recent data suggest that a critical mediator of refolding or clearance of hyperphosphorylated tau is via the HSP70/HSP90 heat shock pathways in which a specific E3 ubiquitin ligase, CHIP (carboxy terminus Hsp70 interacting protein), can recognize and target for degradation abnormal but not normal tau molecules [14–16].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: CHIP is also implicated in regulation of Caspase 3 activity

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: CHIP interacts more strongly with tauΔC than full-length tau [18], suggesting it is involved in caspase cleaved tau degradation

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Dolan et al. [20] showed that CHIP interacts more strongly with tauC3 than full length tau.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: CHIP interacts more strongly with tauΔC than full-length tau [18], suggesting it is involved in caspase cleaved tau degradation

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Recent data suggest that caspases are involved in the accumulation of tau pathology [10, 25, 26], and reductions in CHIP have been shown to cause caspase activation and increased caspase-cleaved tau levels [19].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: These results indicate that CHIP is involved in degradation of caspases and caspase-cleaved tau.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Toxicity assays revealed that neither CHIP nor any of the tau constructs caused cell death compared to the control GFP vector (Supplementary Fig. 1).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: The co-chaperone CHIP interacts with Hsp70/Hsp90 to bind unfolded and misfolded proteins

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: The co-chaperone CHIP interacts with Hsp70/Hsp90 to bind unfolded and misfolded proteins

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Either of these domains could be critical for degradation of tau since ubiquitination targets proteins for degradation and CHIP is known to interact with full-length tau in a complex with Hsc70/Hsp70 and poly-ubiquitinated tau [17].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: After cyclohexamide treatment, we could still detect a significant decrease in tau levels in cells that were co-transfected with CHIP indicating that the reduction in tau levels due to CHIP is due to degradation and not to transcriptional down-regulation (Supplementary Fig. 3).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Recent data suggest that caspases are involved in the accumulation of tau pathology [10, 25, 26], and reductions in CHIP have been shown to cause caspase activation and increased caspase-cleaved tau levels [19].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: These results indicate that CHIP is involved in degradation of caspases and caspase-cleaved tau.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Dolan et al. [20] showed that CHIP interacts more strongly with tauC3 than full length tau.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Tau overexpression increased active caspase 3 levels, and co-expression of CHIP reduced cleaved caspase 3 levels compared to tau expression alone (Fig. 3).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Tau overexpression increased active caspase 3 levels, and co-expression of CHIP reduced cleaved caspase 3 levels compared to tau expression alone (Fig. 3).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In CHIP knockout mice, Caspase 3 activation is increased and caspase-cleaved tau levels are increased [17].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: In CHIP knockout mice, Caspase 3 activation is increased and caspase-cleaved tau levels are increased [17].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Toxicity assays revealed that neither CHIP nor any of the tau constructs caused cell death compared to the control GFP vector (Supplementary Fig. 1).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Recent data suggest that caspases are involved in the accumulation of tau pathology [10, 25, 26], and reductions in CHIP have been shown to cause caspase activation and increased caspase-cleaved tau levels [19].

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Tau overexpression increased active caspase 3 levels, and co-expression of CHIP reduced cleaved caspase 3 levels compared to tau expression alone (Fig. 3).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: As expected, we observed a significant impairment of mitochondrial distribution with overexpression of all three tau constructs (p < 0.0001, Wilcoxon test for GFP control versus 4R-tau, GFP versus tauC3, and GFP versus K18ΔK280) (Fig. 5).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Taken together, these data indicate that tau-overexpression leads to abnormal mitochondrial trafficking that can be rescued by CHIP-co-expression

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Densitometry analysis of total tau levels of H4- cell lysates on SDS-PAGE showed a 2.0 to 2.5 fold lower levels of tau (4R-tau, tauC3, and K18ΔK280) with co-expression with CHIP, respectively (Fig. 1).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Co-transfection of CHIP with 4R-tau leads to a significant increase in Hsp70 levels, however this is not the case with wither tauC3 or K18DK280 constructs (Supplementary Fig. 2) suggesting that increased HSP70 protein levels are not necessary for the observed reduction in tau levels.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Tau overexpression increased active caspase 3 levels, and co-expression of CHIP reduced cleaved caspase 3 levels compared to tau expression alone (Fig. 3).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Indeed, the co-expression of CHIP caused a significant decrease tauC3 in vitro (Fig. 4).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: CHIP co-expression led to a significant recovery in the area of mitochondria around the nucleus (19–26%).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Taken together, these data indicate that tau-overexpression leads to abnormal mitochondrial trafficking that can be rescued by CHIP-co-expression

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Probing for phospho-tau with the 12E8 antibody in cell lysates from K18ΔK280 transfected cells reveals that tau phosphorylation is also decreased by CHIP overexpression (Fig. 1).

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: CHIP has two important domains for his chaperone activity: the amino terminus tetratricopeptide repeat (TPR) domain that links CHIP to Hsp70 and Hsp90 [24] and the carboxyl terminus containing the U-box that is important for the E3 ubiquitin ligase function of CHIP.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Interestingly, a significant decrease in tau levels was seen with the co-transfection of CHIPΔU (U-box deleted) when transfected with either K18ΔK280 or 4R-Tau.

citation.name: Journal of Alzheimer's disease : JAD
citation.title: Carboxy terminus heat shock protein 70 interacting protein reduces tau-associated degenerative changes.

links.evidence: Interestingly, a significant decrease in tau levels was seen with the co-transfection of CHIPΔU (U-box deleted) when transfected with either K18ΔK280 or 4R-Tau.
